Idiom (Mon): မၞိဟ်ပၠံင်သၟတ်လိက်မၞး
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To speak without thinking or to reveal something unintentionally.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Common among Mon traders and villagers; implies carelessness in speech.
First Example Sentence: မၞိဟ်ပၠံင်သၟတ်လိက်မၞး ပလံင်ဍုၚ်အအဲၜ။
Second Example Sentence: သၟတ်ပၠံင်သၟတ်လိက်မၞး လောဝ်ညဳဟွံကောန်။
Third Example Sentence: ဍုၚ်အဂွံလၟပ် မၞိဟ်ပၠံင်သၟတ်လိက်မၞး။

Syntactic Structure & Grammatical Form: Verb phrase; causative with reflexive form
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To be overly proud or self-centered.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Traditional Mon proverb about humility and pride.
Second Example Sentence: တၟိကၟာ်ကေၚ် မၞိဟ်မိန်မိန်ဍုၚ်ကဵု။
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent: မၞိဟ်အတၟိနိင်။

Idiom (Mon): ညၞေန်အဂၠိုင်မၞး
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Derived from Mon belief that night symbolizes uncertainty.
Second Example Sentence: ညၞေန်အဂၠိုင်မၞး မိန်အဴကလှာ။
Third Example Sentence: ဍုၚ်မၞိဟ်ညၞေန်အဂၠိုင်မၞး မသုန်။
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent: မၞိဟ်မသိအတေ။

Idiom (Mon): တၟိကၠုၚ်သၟတ်အဲၜမၞး
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Refers to the act of sycophancy seen in royal courts.
First Example Sentence: မၞိဟ်တၟိကၠုၚ်သၟတ်အဲၜမၞး ဗၟာအနာံ။
Second Example Sentence: တၟိကၠုၚ်သၟတ်အဲၜမၞး ဍုၚ်အထာ်။
Third Example Sentence: ဍုၚ်ကောန်တၟိကၠုၚ်သၟတ်အဲၜမၞး မုဲမၞး။
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent: မၞိဟ်ပလံင်မၞးအတေ။
Figurative Meaning: To flatter someone for personal gain.

Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Mon teachers use this to describe inattentive students.
First Example Sentence: ဍုၚ်သၞင်အိၣ်လှာတၟံင်မၞး မၞိဟ်အအဲၜ။
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent: မၞိဟ်မဍုၚ်အတေ။

Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Expresses the Mon sense of diligence and busyness.
First Example Sentence: ဍုၚ်မုဲမုဲကၟာ်ကေၚ် မိန်အအဲၜ။
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent: မၞိဟ်အလုပ်လှာ။
Figurative Meaning: To be extremely busy or preoccupied.

Idiom (Mon): မၞိဟ်တၞဲသၟတ်တၟါ
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: A moral idiom used in family teachings about humility.
Third Example Sentence: ဍုၚ်မၞိဟ်တၞဲသၟတ်တၟါ။
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent: မၞိဟ်မလျာအတေ။

Idiom (Mon): အဝ်သၟတ်အတေသၟတ်
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Reflects Mon cultural appreciation for steadiness.
First Example Sentence: မၞိဟ်အဝ်သၟတ်အတေသၟတ် လှာသၟတ်။
Second Example Sentence: အဝ်သၟတ်အတေသၟတ် မၞိဟ်မၞး။
Third Example Sentence: ဍုၚ်အဝ်သၟတ်အတေသၟတ် ပလံင်သၟတ်။
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent: မၞိဟ်မတိအတေ။

Idiom (Mon): ဓမၠိုၚ်သၟတ်တၟါ
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Rooted in Mon Buddhist expression for virtue and sincerity.
First Example Sentence: ဍုၚ်ဓမၠိုၚ်သၟတ်တၟါ မုဲမၞး။
Second Example Sentence: ဓမၠိုၚ်သၟတ်တၟါ မိန်လှာ။
Third Example Sentence: မၞိဟ်ဓမၠိုၚ်သၟတ်တၟါ လုၚ်ကောန်။
Figurative Meaning: To do something with extreme sincerity or dedication.

Idiom (Mon): နုဲပံက်သၟတ်အဲၜမၞး
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Reflects Mon temper imagery associated with heat.
First Example Sentence: မၞိဟ်နုဲပံက်သၟတ်အဲၜမၞး ဍုၚ်အအဲၜ။
Second Example Sentence: နုဲပံက်သၟတ်အဲၜမၞး မုဲလှာ။
Third Example Sentence: ဍုၚ်နုဲပံက်သၟတ်အဲၜမၞး မုဲသၟတ်။
